summary: This document is a series of evidence custody forms from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General, detailing property seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019. The seized items include personnel files for four BOP staff, post orders, sign-in sheets, training records, log entries, and financial records related to inmates Jeffrey Epstein and others, as part of an investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Evidence Seizure at MCC
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General seized property from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), including personnel files, log entries, post orders, and inmate financial records.

events.title: Evidence Transferred to Storage
events.description: The seized evidence items were released and received for evidence inventory and storage.

events.title: Quarterly SHU Training
events.description: A record of Quarterly Special Housing Unit (SHU) training conducted on this date was among the seized items.

locations: BOP MCC (Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center)
keyFacts: Personnel files for four BOP staff members (M. Thomas, T. Noel, J. Adams, G. Anderson-Layne) were seized from the MCC on August 20, 2019.
The seized evidence includes financial records (TruView documents) related to inmates Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. #76318-054), Reyes (Reg. #85993-054), and Ruben (Reg. #76220-054).
The seizure was part of OIG investigation NYFO 2019-010614, which appears to be related to the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
Operational documents like post orders, sign-in sheets, lieutenant logs, and daily forms from July and August 2019 were collected.
All seized evidence was transferred to inventory/storage on August 22, 2019, establishing a chain of custody.
